content.full_text: Resolution regarding the Incorporation of a Canal Company, 11 December 18351 On motion of Mr.Lincoln, Ordered, That Messrs. Lincoln,Brown,Gordon,CarpenterofSangamon, andTrower, be that committee.
paragraphs: Resolution regarding the Incorporation of a Canal Company, 11 December 18351 On motion of Mr.Lincoln, Ordered, That Messrs. Lincoln,Brown,Gordon,CarpenterofSangamon, andTrower, be that committee.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln introduced this resolution in theHouse of Representativeson December 11, 1835. The House adopted the resolution and formed a five-person select
                  committee including Lincoln to investigate the wisdom of incorporating a canal company
                  to build a canal on the Sangamon River.  On December 12, Lincoln reported the committeeâ€™s
                  findings and introducedHB 7to create theBeardstown and Sangamon Canal Company.Illinois HouseJournal. 1835.  9th G. A., 2nd sess., 34, 38.

structured_content.text: Resolution regarding the Incorporation of a Canal Company, 11 December 18351
Ordered, That Messrs.[Messieurs] Lincoln,Brown,Gordon,CarpenterofSangamon, andTrower, be that committee.
